form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Baldwin introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To provide for the advancement of energy-water efficiency research, development, and deployment activities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Water Efficiency Innovation Act of 2015 .

paragraph.text: The term Department means the Department of Energy.
The term Industrial Assessment Center means a center located at an institution of higher education that—

subparagraph.text: provides an in-depth assessment of small- and medium-sized manufacturer plant sites to evaluate the facilities, services, and manufacturing operations of the plant sites; and

identifies opportunities for potential savings for small- and medium-sized manufacturer plant sites from energy efficiency improvements, waste minimization, pollution prevention, and productivity improvement.

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of Energy.

section.header: Leveraging existing agency programs to advance energy-water efficiency

paragraph.text: through the Industrial Assessment Centers of the Department, the Department provides technical assistance to facilitate efficiency improvements at small- and medium-sized manufacturers while training engineering students for energy careers;
the efficiency improvements described in paragraph (1) reduce energy demand, help manufacturers operate more competitively, and catalyze the use of new technologies and best practices;
water and wastewater treatment are energy-intensive processes, and opportunities for efficiency upgrades can be limited by technical expertise, particularly at small utilities; and

through the Industrial Assessment Centers of the Department, the Department has recently engaged with the Environmental Protection Agency in a pilot effort to target energy efficiency in water and wastewater treatment facilities.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall expand the Industrial Assessment Centers of the Department, working across Federal agencies as necessary—

paragraph.text: to provide comparable assessment services to water and wastewater treatment facilities, including systems that treat municipal, industrial, and agricultural waste; and
to equip the Directors of the Industrial Assessment Centers with the training and tools necessary to provide technical assistance on energy savings to those facilities.

section.text: The Secretary shall carry out this Act using unobligated funds of the Department.
